briefTitle: Assess Safety and Efficacy of ELAD (Extracorporeal Liver Assist System) in Subjects With Alcohol-Induced Liver Failure

interventions.name: Standard of care (Control)
otherNames: Standard of care as defined by the protocol

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary endpoint of the study was a comparison of overall survival (OS) between the ELAD-treated and Control groups, with protocol VTI-208E providing additional survival data up to a maximum of 5 years, that was included as available at the time of database lock (31 July 2015).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Survivors at Study Day 91.
outcomeMeasures.description: Assess the proportion of survivors at Study Day 91.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Progression-free Survivors at Study Day 91
outcomeMeasures.description: An exploratory objective is to evaluate the ability of ELAD® to stabilize liver function, measured using the MELD-based time to progression (TTP), with progression defined as death or the first observed increase of at least 5 points from End of Study Day 1 MELD score (for both the ELAD and Control groups) until at least 24 hours after the ELAD Treatment Period is ended (end of Day 7 for Controls) and up to both End of Study Days 28 and 91 following Randomization.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival for Subjects With Age<50, MELD<30, Bili>=16, INR<=2.5 and Creatinine<1.3
